subject: Re: [junit] Can Junit do coverage analysis?
msgSnippet: Hi, JUnit can test each and every method in a java class. it is upto we have to pass the parameters to get the each line of the code get executed and get the
messageBody:
Hi,
JUnit can test each and every method in a java class.
it is upto we have to pass the parameters to get the
each line of the code get executed and get the
result.from which we will compare the result.This way
we can say that JUnit will do Converage of the whole
Code but analysis is only upto method level.
like we have to call assertEquals(expected,actual)
kind of method where actual is the return value of the
actual test method and offcourse expected is what we
need to imagine and should give.
it will tell u wheather it is equal or not.
thats it.
S V Sekhar
CellExchange

--- Xiaochen DU <duxiaochen@...> wrote:
> I want to find a tool to do Java program coverage
> analysis ( at
> least statement level). I never used junit before.
> Can anybody give
> me a quick answer to my two sample questions.
>
> 1) Can junit can do coverage analysis? How?
> As my understanding, it should have a parser for
> java program. and
> enable to add instrumentation code easily.
>
> 2) If junit can not be used to do coverage analysis,
> do anybody now
> a good open source tool can do so?
>
> Your answer is highly appreciated.
>
> Xiaochen
>
>
>
